issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Schedulers should manage their own implementations of SchedulerApp and SchedulerNode.
fields.summary: Change SchedulerApp & SchedulerNode to be a minimal interface

comments.body: Straight-fwd (albeit large) patch for a simple refactor of SchedulerApp and SchedulerNode into abstract classes with a minimal interface set.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12536579/MAPREDUCE-4440.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 5 new or modified test files.

    -1 javac.  The applied patch generated 2067 javac compiler warnings (more than the trunk's current 2066 warnings).

    -1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool appears to have generated 5 warning messages.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    -1 findbugs.  The patch appears to introduce 4 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed these unit tests in hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager:

                  org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.TestClientRMService

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/2594//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/2594//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager.html
Javac warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/2594//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/diffJavacWarnings.txt

This message is automatically generated.

All I have had time for so far is a quick look through the code.  I will try to find time to go more in-depth, although most everything seems to be fairly straight forward refactoring.

My first question is what does "FiCa" stand for? 

It looks like you left some DUMMY_APPLICATION_ATTEMPT_NUMBER debugging code inside RMAppImpl.java, if it is not debugging I need to look more closely at what it is doing.

Inside FSSchedulerApp could you add in @Override for the methods that implement/override SchedulerApplication methods. And similarly for FSSchedulerNode and SchedulerNode.
Thanks Bobby, I'll add the @Override. The change in RMAppImpl is just to get the test (TestRMClientService) happy.
I am still curious what FiCa Stands for in FiCaSchedulerApp and FiCaSchedulerNode and in the fica package as well.
Fixed javadoc/javac warnings and added @Override as suggested by Bobby.
Ah, sorry. It's a bad name for fifo-capacity... couldn't come up with a better one! :)

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12536687/MAPREDUCE-4440.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 5 new or modified test files.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    -1 findbugs.  The patch appears to introduce 4 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager.

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/2600//console

This message is automatically generated.

OK so the FiCa classes are only shared between those two and not the Fair Scheduler, hence the new package and everything.  Makes since.  I will try to dig in more deeply.  It might be nice to add in a package-info.java or some JavaDocs for those classes explaining this, just so someone new can look at them and understand what these classes are for.

I will try to dig into it more deeply soon.

OK I have been looking into the patch more deeply.

I understand now what DUMMY_APPLICATION_ATTEMPT_NUMBER is for.  Inside RMAppImpl.createAndGetApplicationReport there appears to be a bug. if allowAcces is true and currentAttempt != null currentApplicationAttemptId is set to the correct value, and then reset to the dummy value a few lines later.  that Dummy value then gets used at the end of the method in building the application report.  I think we want an else in front of {code}currentApplicationAttemptId = 
            BuilderUtils.newApplicationAttemptId(this.applicationId, 
                DUMMY_APPLICATION_ATTEMPT_NUMBER);{code}

Other then that I am a +1.
Thanks for the review Bobby and for catching the snafu, fixed now.
